intro: Elachia spinulosa, commonly known as the spiny elachia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, spiny leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Elachia spinulosa is often found in scrublands and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
